title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for using L'Hospital's Rule correctly at least once

1 point is earned for the answer

Since g is continuous,

g(0)= lim x→0 g(x)= lim x→0 cos(2x)−1 x 2        = lim x→0 −2sin(2x) 2x        = lim x→0 −4cos(2x) 2 =−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@820F@
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for using L'Hospital's Rule correctly at least once

1 point is earned for the answer

Since g is continuous,

g(0)= lim x→0 g(x)= lim x→0 cos(2x)−1 x 2        = lim x→0 −2sin(2x) 2x        = lim x→0 −4cos(2x) 2 =−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@820F@

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for using L'Hospital's Rule correctly at least once

1 point is earned for the answer

Since g is continuous,

g(0)= lim x→0 g(x)= lim x→0 cos(2x)−1 x 2        = lim x→0 −2sin(2x) 2x        = lim x→0 −4cos(2x) 2 =−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@820F@

The student earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for using L'Hospital's Rule correctly at least once

1 point is earned for the answer

Since g is continuous,

g(0)= lim x→0 g(x)= lim x→0 cos(2x)−1 x 2        = lim x→0 −2sin(2x) 2x        = lim x→0 −4cos(2x) 2 =−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@820F@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the first two terms

1 point is earned for the next two terms

1 point is earned for the general term

cos(2x)=1− (2x) 2 2! + (2x) 4 4! − (2x) 6 6! +⋅⋅⋅+ ( −1 ) n (2x) 2n (2n)! +⋅⋅⋅             =1− 4 2! x 2 + 16 4! x 4 − 64 6! x 6 +⋅⋅⋅+ ( −1 ) n 2 2n (2n)! x 2n +⋅⋅⋅ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@A643@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the first three terms

1 point is earned for the general term

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

1 point is earned for the justification

g ′ (x)= 2⋅16 4! x− 4⋅64 6! x 3 +⋅⋅⋅, so  g ′ (0)=0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5B2D@

g ″ (x)= 2⋅16 4! − 3⋅4⋅64 6! x 2 +⋅⋅⋅, so  g ″ (0)>0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5D3A@

Therefore, g has a relative minimum at x = 0 by the Second Derivative Test.
